evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Founded in 1872, Plaintiff American Public Health Association (“APHA”) represents about 50,000 people through organizational and individual memberships and has more than 23,000 individual public health professional members. APHA acts to build capacity in the public health community and champions optimal, equitable health and well-being for all.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: American Public Health Association (50,000 members, public health advocacy organization representing researchers)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Founded in 2002, Plaintiff Ibis Reproductive Health (“Ibis”) is a global research organization that drives change through bold, rigorous research and principled partnerships that advance sexual and reproductive autonomy, choice, and health worldwide.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Ibis Reproductive Health (global research organization focused on sexual and reproductive health, including transgender and gender diverse populations)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace and Agricultural Implement Workers of America (“UAW”) is one of the largest and most diverse unions in North America, with members in the United States, Canada and Puerto Rico and in virtually every sector of the economy. ... Tens of thousands of UAW members rely on NIH grant funding for their jobs and training.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace, and Agricultural Implement Workers (UAW) (large union representing 1,000,000+ members, including researchers and staff at universities)
